subject: Re: Question for box users
author: Steve Hultay
full_text:
I edit my files to display the answer, i.e---if i ask what is your name 
and 14 seconds later they say "clyde".  At that point i will cut out 
the 14 seconds of nothing and just leave the answer to my question.  
Sometimes i have to make the file a bit louder, but no mods to the 
actual file.  It is what it is and i leave it in raw format for all to 
hear, the less you mess with the files is better to bring people onto 
this side of the fence.

-Steve H.


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Rebecca" <rak4dds@...> wrote:
>
> Hello All -
> 
> I have been studying this format of communication for better part of 
a 
> year now.  I have been listening to clips and reading posts here for 
> sometime and am impressed with direction of your work.  The majority 
of 
> clips I've listened to, regardless of the type of box used, are quite 
> clear.  My question to you is as follows:  are the files edited or 
> changed at all or is this the quality they are coming through at?  
> 
> - Rak
>
